intro: Hieracium bipediforme, commonly known as the two-footed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium bipediforme is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain habitats.
